newsitem.title: UK: TENNIS-RUSEDSKI WITHDRAWAL LEAVES BRITAIN EXPOSED.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-RUSEDSKI WITHDRAWAL LEAVES BRITAIN EXPOSED.

text.p: Britain's number two tennis player, Greg Rusedski, pulled out on Tuesday from the team to face Zimbabwe in this weekend's Davis Cup match in London because of a wrist injury.
Number one, Tim Henman, had earlier withdrawn after undergoing surgery on his elbow.
None of Britain's replacements is in the class of Zimbabwe's Byron Black who is ranked 46th.
Britain, who last made the Davis Cup final in 1978, need to win the Crystal Palace match to advance to the world group qualifying round.
Defeat would leave David Lloyd's team facing another season in the backwaters of Euro/Africa group one.
